old: ――なんだ、欲しいものでもあるのか
column2: ――What is it, is there something you want?

old:
おい、回復薬とランタンの火種は
多めに持っとけよ
column2: Hey, make sure to bring plenty of healing potions and a lantern's fire source.

old:
わざわざこんなところまで
運んできてやってんだ――無いと困るだろうが
column2:
I went to all the trouble to bring it here, you know. 
You'd better not be without it.

old:
いいか、普段見ねぇものを見ても慌てるんじゃねぇ
慌てるとロクなことがねぇからな
column2:
Listen, don't panic when you see things you don't usually see. 
Panicking won't do you any good.

old:
だからと言って、自分の知っているものに当てはめて
ナメてかかっても痛い目を見る――
column2: But don't get too cocky and assume that what you know applies to everything; you might still run into trouble.

old:
つまり、大切なのは平常心だ
落ち着いてさえいれば何とかなるからよ
column2: So, what matters most is to keep a calm mind. As long as you remain composed, you can handle anything.

old:
洞窟の中で過ごすっていうのも
悪くはねぇもんだな
column2: Living within the confines of a cave is not such a dire fate, I must say.
